definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: Cui Yongyuan is a famous talk show host .
sentences.chinese: 崔永元是著名的脱口秀主持人。

sentences.english: As a result, networks will be rerunning some late-night talk shows and soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 结果是，网络将播放一些午夜脱口秀和肥皂剧。

sentences.english: That show was renamed "The Oprah Winfrey Show" in 1985.
sentences.chinese: 这档节目在1985年改名为《奥普拉脱口秀》。

sentences.english: I think talk shows are non-sense.
sentences.chinese: 我认为脱口秀一点意思也没有。

sentences.english: "It has become more than a show, " Chen says.
sentences.chinese: “这个节目已不仅仅是一场脱口秀，”陈鲁豫说。

sentences.english: A job interview is a one-direction conversation, like on a talk show。
sentences.chinese: 工作面试是单向的谈话，像脱口秀一样。

sentences.english: TV Talkshow, as a popular means of TV program, originated from the western countries.
sentences.chinese: 我国的电视谈话节目由西方“脱口秀”借鉴而来。

sentences.english: Do you know Oprah Winfrey? She is the host of a famous U. S. talk show.
sentences.chinese: 知道美国那个脱口秀主持人奥普拉吗？

sentences.english: He was the sort of person you would see on talk shows.
sentences.chinese: 他就像现在上脱口秀的明星一样有名。

definition: online variety show (contracted form of 網絡綜藝節目|网络综艺节目)
speaking and singing, as in various forms of storytelling such as 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2] and 相聲|相声[xiang4 sheng5]/(music) rapping
